result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcarious S Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Attnd school and complete all school work.  Obey all school rules.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Reside with mother and comply with her rules.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Folllow through with recommendations.  Engage in mentoring program through church or YMCA.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.
Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI) testing and monitoring fees.  $150.00 paid from cash bond posted.  $1,513.00 remains due and owing.

Defendant Marcarious S Scott in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
PSI received and reviewed.
State's recommendation:  On each file - probation recommendation, jail time (amount up to Court), appropriate conditions (employment, education, job training, no alcohol, controlled substances)
Defense sentencing argument.  Requesting imposed and stayed sentence with probation.
Statement by defendant.  Possible expungment requested.
Statement by defendant's mother

Defendant Marcarious S Scott in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Marcarious S Scott in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove for Atty Laura Ann Walker.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense counsel is not available for court today. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

from Caroline Johnson requesting court's permission for deft to attend grandfather's funeral on 11/28/15 - forwarded to Judge Jude
BTC:  ok to attend; must be in company of Caroline Johnson and provide statement to ZCI from funeral home or church that deft attended.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, SMR (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendant, XS.   Make all court appearances on time.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting w/his Atty and school. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Marcarious S Scott in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Marcarious S Scott in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
